content.title: Legal Aid To Scheduled Castes And Vimukat Jatis Scheme
content.department: Department of Welfare of Schedule Castes and Backward Classes
content.beneficiary: Members of Scheduled Castes and Vimukat Jatis
content.details: The scheme 'Legal Aid to Scheduled Castes and Vimukat Jatis Scheme' was launched by the Department of Welfare of Schedule Castes and Backward Classes, Haryana on 13th February 1961. The scheme is a 50:50 sharing basis scheme of the Government of India/State Government. Under the scheme, this department provides Legal Aid to the member of Scheduled Caste and Vimukat Jatis for defending and instituting various cases.
benefits: An amount of ₹22000/- is paid to the member of Scheduled Castes & Vimukat Jatis for defending his/her cases relating to the Land, Rent, etc. pending in the court.
eligibility: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Haryana State.
The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Caste or Vimukat Jatis of Haryana State to avail of the benefits of the scheme.
documents_required: Identity proof i.e. Voter ID, Aadhaar Card

faqs.question: What is 'Legal Aid to Scheduled Castes and Vimukat Jatis Scheme' scheme?
faqs.answer: Under the scheme, the members of the Scheduled Castes & Vimukat Jatis shall be eligible for the grant of legal aid for defending and instituting their cases in court.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Department of Welfare of Schedule Castes and Backward Classes, Haryana.

faqs.question: When was this scheme launched?
faqs.answer: This scheme was launched on 13th February 1961.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to get the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The members of Scheduled Castes & Vimukat Jatis who are permanent residents of Haryana State are eligible to apply under the scheme.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for a resident of Haryana State?
faqs.answer: Yes, the applicant must be a permanent resident of Haryana State.

faqs.question: Can an applicant of the general category also apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, under this scheme only the applicants belonging to the Scheduled Castes & Vimukat Jatis categories are eligible to apply.

faqs.question: What is the benefit of the scheme?
faqs.answer: An amount of ₹22000/- is paid to the member of Scheduled Castes & Vimukat Jatis for defending his/her cases relating to the Land, Rent, etc. pending in the court.

faqs.question: Is this scheme state sponsored scheme?
faqs.answer: No, This is a 50:50 sharing basis scheme of the Government of India/State Government.

faqs.question: How Can An Applicant Apply Under The Scheme?
faqs.answer: The Eligible Applicant May Apply Online Mode.

faqs.question: How Can An Applicant Apply Online Under The Scheme?
faqs.answer: For Online Application, The Applicant Should Visit The Official Portal - Antyodaya-SARAL Portal.
